clinical_study.brief_title: Pain Outcomes Following Video-Assisted Thoracic Surgery (VATS) With LAP Protector
clinical_study.official_title: Pain Outcomes Following Video-Assisted Thoracic Surgery (VATS) With Rigid Spreading Versus Soft Spreading (Using LAP Protector)

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to see if different types of spreading (rigid or soft) of Video-assisted Thoracoscopic Surgery (VATS) for lung cancer have different effects on pain.

detailed_description.textblock: The Lap-Protector (Hakko Co., Japan) is a device that consists of two flexible rings made of superelasticity alloys covered with polyurethane polyamide, and a thin silicone rubber membrane that is attached to the outer rim of the two rings. If the two rings are pulled apart, the device assumes a cylindrical shape. The outer diameter of each flexible ring is 12 cm, and this device can be used for minilaparotomy wounds between 5 and 9cm long.

primary_outcome.measure: Compare the level of postoperative pain between the rigid and soft spreading groups
primary_outcome.description: The level of postoperative pain was measured by Visual Analogue Scale (VAS).

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare early postoperative analgesic requirements between the rigid and soft spreading groups
secondary_outcome.description: Postoperative analgesic requirements (e.g. the amount of morphine titration).

arm_group.description: Patients with lung cancer underwent Video-assisted Thoracoscopic Surgery (VATS) with soft spreading (using LAP Protector).
Patients with lung cancer underwent Video-assisted Thoracoscopic Surgery (VATS) with rigid spreading.

intervention.description: The LAP Protector is a device that consists of two flexible rings made of superelasticity alloys covered with polyurethane polyamide, and a thin silicone rubber membrane that is attached to the outer rim of the two rings

study_pop.textblock: Patients with non-small cell lung cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Non-small cell lung cancer stage IB - IIIA
- ECOG status 0-1
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior chemotherapy and/or radiation therapy for lung cancer
- Peripheral neuropathy > grade 1
- Concurrent other malignancies, other than basal cell or squamous cell carcinoma of the skin or carcinoma in situ of the cervix
- Medical condition that will not permit treatment or follow up according to the protocol
- Pregnant or nursing women
- HIV-positive patients
